Description: Stamp (vessel): qisṭ. With five line inscription. Piece of rim attached. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4061. From the same die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 147; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 326. Cf. Castiglioni, Carlo Ottavio. 1847. ‘Dell’uso cui erano destinati i vetri con epigrafi cufiche, e della origine, estensione e durata di esso’. Milan, 24; Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 161-2; Balog 1976, 327-8.

A specimen of the half-qisṭ denomination in the series issued by ʿAbd al-Malik b. Yazīd and Muḥammad b. Shuraḥbīl has been published by Miles (1948, 51), who incorrectly attributed it to ʿAbd al-Malik b. Marwān. Miles has also described (1964, 27) a qisṭ with the name of ʿAbd al-Malik b. Yazīd alone. Bibliography: Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York; Miles, G.C. 1964. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (186)
Associated names: Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Malik b. Yazīd
Named in inscription: Muḥammad b. Shuraḥbīl
